location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from James Charles Edwards, Bushire to Colonel Lewis Pelly

mods.abstract: Letter regarding his awaiting Pelly's arrival, and the assumption that the strong shemaul [wind] has detained him.The letter goes on to report on Mohurrum [Muharram] which had recently been celebrated in Bushire and that although the artillery walking the streets with drawn swords and bleeding heads, which had been recreated through small cuts with a razor, no accidents or incidents of any kind had been reported.The letter concludes by reporting that Mehdy Khan [Mehdi Khan] and Syed Abdool Azeez [Sayyid Abdu'l-Aziz bin Said al-Said] are still in Bushire.
